moves.1. e4: Another game from the Ruy Lopez mini-tournament.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4 Nf6: I don't play the Ruy, so now I'm not sure if this is main line or not.
moves.10. dxc6 exf3 11. d4: I'm notating this game after-the-fact for once, and I don't remember what all was happening here. Perhaps I'm trying to get a pawn up on d5.
moves.11... Re8 12. Bg5 Bg4 13. h3 Bh5 14. Bxf: I know I'll get the pawn at some time.
moves.17... Qd6 18. Qe3: He may think my queen's after the pawn, but I've got another idea. He's starting to get fewer pieces on his back row, and I plan to take advantage of that.
moves.18... Qxc6: I wanted the queen there. He doesn't see the danger his queen & rook are in.
moves.19. Re1 Kf8 20. g5: Here comes the trap. The best he can do now is to take the pawn.
moves.20... Bd8: Stop here. Do you see White's winning move?
moves.21. Bd5:
Here's the Remove the Defender tactic in action.   
If he captures the bishop, I play Qe8#. If he moves the queen to d7, then I win a rook
